posts.post_content:
(Hmm. he's done nothing but play [Island](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Island) turn after turn. Its turn 5, I'd better make my move.)

\*looks at hand\*  
[Giant Shark](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Giant Shark) [Giant Shark](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Giant Shark) [Giant Shark](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Giant Shark) [Giant Shark](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Giant Shark) [Island](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Island) [Island](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Island)  
(Ohhhhh no. Not the god hand again!)

posts.post_content:
You know, the card doesn't actually say, "target player shows you the cards he/she is holding in their hand." Therefore, when this card is played, you could argue that all you have to do is show your opponent your palms.
  
   
You won't win the argument though.
posts.html:

You won't win the argument though.
